tn.ref: take you away with hooks, the last of you with fishhooks
tn.text: These two lines mean basically the same thing and emphasize that the enemy will capture the people like people catch fish. AT: "defeat all of you and force you to go away with them" or "put you on hooks like fish and take you away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: breaks in the city wall
tn.text: places where the enemy had broken down the city wall to enter

tn.ref: you will be thrown out toward Harmon
tn.text: "they will throw you out toward Harmon" or "your enemies will force you to leave the city and go toward Harmon" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Harmon
tn.text: This may be a place name that we do not know. Or it might refer to Mount Hermon, and some modern versions interpret it in that way. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh
tn.text: This phrase is used to show that the things God spoke about surely will happen. Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:02:11|2:11]].

tn.ref: Go to Bethel and sin, to Gilgal and multiply sin
tn.text: "Because you refuse to repent, the sacrifices you offer at Bethel and Gilgal only make me more angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])

tn.ref: bring your sacrifices ... your tithes ... Offer a thanksgiving sacrifice ... proclaim freewill offerings; announce them
tn.text: If your language has a way to show that the people refuse to understand that doing these things will do them no good but they will not stop doing them, you may want to use it here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])

tn.ref: your tithes every three days
tn.text: Instead of "every three days," some versions have "every three years." This is because the Israelites were supposed to bring their tithes to God once every three years.

tn.ref: declaration of the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:03:13|3:13]].

tn.ref: cleanness of teeth
tn.text: "hunger" or "starvation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: you have not returned to me
tn.text: AT: "you have not stopped sinning against me"

tn.ref: declaration of Yahweh
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:02:11|2:11]].

tn.ref: I afflicted you with blight and mildew
tn.text: "Sometimes I gave you too little rain and sometimes too much rain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: blight
tn.text: disease that dries and kills plants

tn.ref: mildew
tn.text: bad growth on things that stay wet too long

tn.ref: you have not returned to me
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:04:06|4:6]].

tn.ref: declaration of Yahweh
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:02:11|2:11]].

tn.ref: made the stench of your camp come up to your nostrils
tn.text: AT: "filled the air with the stench of your camp" or "you could not get away from the stench of your camp."

tn.ref: stench
tn.text: very bad smell, especially of dead people

tn.ref: You were like a burning stick snatched out of the fire
tn.text: AT: "I quickly pulled you out of the fire like you were a burning stick" or "I let you burn part way before I quickly pulled you out of the fire." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you have not returned to me
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:04:06|4:6]].

tn.ref: declaration of Yahweh
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:02:11|2:11]].
